thread.title: The men take over in S.F. Opera’s ‘Lucia’
thread.title_full: The men take over in S.F. Opera’s ‘Lucia’ - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Joshua Kosman
title: The men take over in S.F. Opera’s ‘Lucia’
text:
Nicolas Testé (Raimondo), Brian Mulligan (Enrico), Piotr Beczala (Edgardo), Chong Wang (Arturo) and Zanda Svede (Alisa) in “Lucia di Lammermoor.” Nicolas Testé (Raimondo), Brian Mulligan (Enrico), Piotr Beczala...
The sexual politics of Donizetti’s “Lucia di Lammermoor,” in which two implacable men engage in a brutal tug-of-war over the helpless title character, are a feminist’s bane under the best of circumstances. The struggle felt even more lopsided than usual on Thursday night at the War Memorial Opera House, during the opening performance of the San Francisco Opera’s vocally splendid but dramatically inert new production. Nicolas Testé (Raimondo), Brian Mulligan (Enrico), Piotr Beczala (Edgardo), Chong Wang (Arturo) and Zanda Svede (Alisa) in “Lucia di Lammermoor.” Nicolas Testé (Raimondo), Brian Mulligan (Enrico), Piotr Beczala...
The sexual politics of Donizetti’s “Lucia di Lammermoor,” in which two implacable men engage in a brutal tug-of-war over the helpless title character, are a feminist’s bane under the best of circumstances. The struggle felt even more lopsided than usual on Thursday night at the War Memorial Opera House, during the opening performance of the San Francisco Opera’s vocally splendid but dramatically inert new production.
